parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the provided post.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>False. The post does not refer to any parliamentary candidate or party. It discusses a water supply interruption due to a pipe repair in Botoșani, Romania.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True. The post targets a wide audience within Botoșani, specifically those affected by the water supply interruption.  The paid Facebook post ensures wide reach.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>False. The objective of the post is to inform the public about a planned water service interruption, not to influence votes in any election.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>True. The post can be considered a form of citizen journalism, aiming to inform the public about a matter of local interest. It presents factual information regarding the water supply interruption and the affected areas.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>False. The post does not express any personal opinions or attempt to sway public opinion on any political matter.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>2007868383019246</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post from Vocea - Botosani, concerning a planned water service interruption, does not constitute electoral propaganda.  The content is purely informational, relating to a local service disruption. There is no mention of any political candidate, party, or any attempt to influence voting behavior. The targeting of specific locations within Botoșani is relevant to the service interruption announcement and not an attempt to influence voters in a specific area. The post's objective is to inform citizens about a planned service disruption, not to promote a political agenda.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>FALSE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates/>
<responsible-party-or-group>Vocea Botosani</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police/>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
